#+title: OU:M208:Unit-A1:Distance Between Two Points in the plane
#+filetags: OU M208 Mathematics Geometry Plane Points Distance

#+header: :width 800 :height 400 :units px
#+begin_src R :file ./assets/images/autogenerated/ou_m208_unit_1_distance_between_two_points.png :results output graphics file :exports result
library(ggplot2)
library(cowplot)
library(grid)

distance <-
  qplot(2, 2) +
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = 7.80, ymin = 2, xmax = 8, ymax = 2.45, colour = "black", alpha = 0.2, fill = "transparent")) +
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 2, y = 1.80, label = "P(x_1, y_1)") +
  geom_point(aes(x = 8, y = 8)) +
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 8, y = 8.20, label = "Q(x_2, y_2)") +
  geom_point(aes(x = 8, y = 2)) +
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 8.40, y = 2.10, label = "N(x_2, y_1)") +
  geom_segment(aes(x = 2, y = 2, xend = 8, yend = 8)) +
  geom_segment(aes(x = 2, y = 2, xend = 8, yend = 2, colour = "run", alpha = 0.5)) +
  geom_segment(aes(x = 8, y = 8, xend = 8, yend = 2, colour = "rise", alpha = 0.5)) +
  theme(axis.line = element_line(color="black", arrow = arrow())) +
  xlab("x") +
  ylab("y") +
  theme(axis.title.x = element_text(hjust = 1)) +
  theme(axis.title.y = element_text(hjust = 1))


plot_grid(distance) + labs(caption = "Distance Between P and Q in the plane") + theme(plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "italic"))
#+end_src

#+RESULTS:
[[file:./assets/images/autogenerated/ou_m208_unit_1_distance_between_two_points.png]]

Suppose that \(P(x_1, y_1)\) and \(Q(x_2, y_2)\) are any two points in the plane.
We can construct \(\triangle PNQ\) where \(\overleftrightarrow{PN}\) is parallel to the x-axis, \(\overleftrightarrow{QN}\) is parallel to the y-axis, the angle \(PNQ\) is a right angle and \(\overleftrightarrow{PQ}\) is the hypotenuse of the triangle.

The length of \(\overleftrightarrow{PN}\) is \(\left| x_2 - x_1 \right|\) and the length of \(\overleftrightarrow{QN}\) is \(\left| y_2 - y_1 \right|\).
Then, by /Pytagoras' Theorem/, \(PQ^2 = PN^2 + QN^2\) and considering that \(\left| k^2 \right| = k^2\) for any real number we have that:

\begin{equation*}
PQ = \sqrt{(x_2 - x_1)^2 + (y_2 - y_1)^2}
\end{equation*}


#+LATEX_HEADER: \usepackage{tcolorbox}

\begin{tcolorbox}[title=Distance formula for $\mathbb{R}^2$]
The distance between the two points $(x_1, y_1)$ and $(x_2, y_2)$ in the plane is

\begin{equation*}
\sqrt{(x_2 - x_1)^2 + (y_2 - y_1)^2}
\end{equation*}

\end{tcolorbox}
